stories.text:
I work on a Kubernetes based infrastructure platform and am interested to know what issues do service developers face.

We can constrain the conversation to stateless services and batch workloads, keeping DBs outside, since they require a more hand managed solution from what I see.

How do you think of: 1. Tenancy 2. Multi-cluster strategy 3. Monitoring 4. Shared responsibility between service devs and infra providers?

It would be interesting to hear from all sides - service devs, infra devs, sres and devops engineers.
stories.title: Ask HN: What's lacking in your internal build and deploy pipeline
Not smart but clever? The return of 'dumbphones'

stories.text:
One of the things that I love about Github Actions is the experience of having a single user experience for continuous integration and continuous deployment. Last year we switched to Github Actions because of Bitbucket Pipelines instability. Recently Github Actions has been an even worse experience than github actions was before.

I was wondering if anyone had experience with stable hosted CI/CD offerings that might have a similar experience to Github Actions from a development standpoint with a lot more platform stability.
stories.title: Ask HN: Can someone recommend a more stable alternative to GitHub Actions?
